abstract: Transform a function and learn how changing the function equation changes the shape of the graph. PLEASE NOTE: This activity can be assigned, but student responses will not be saved.
description:
A reflection is a transformation of the graph of a function over the x-axis or the y-axis (or both). The function retains its basic shape; however, by including a negative sign in the appropriate place in the equation, the graph of the function will flip over one or the other of the axes. By the end of the activity students will be able to identify a given function reflection, identify the way the graph will change and sketch a graph of the reflected function. This is the third of five activities about transformations of functions, focusing on: translations, dilations, reflections, all transformations, and inverses of functions.
